{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[1138]] &ndash; A [[1138 Aleppo earthquake|massive earthquake]] strikes [[Aleppo]], [[Syria]].
*[[1142]] &ndash; A [[Treaty of Shaoxing|peace treaty]] between the [[Jin Dynasty (1115–1234)|Jin Dynasty]] and [[Song Dynasty|Southern Song Dynasty]] is formally ratified when a Jin envoy visits the Song court during the [[Jurchen campaigns against the Song Dynasty|Jin–Song wars]].
*[[1531]] &ndash; [[Huldrych Zwingli]] is killed in battle with the Roman Catholic cantons of Switzerland.
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar]], this day does not exist in this year in [[Italy]], [[Poland]], [[Portugal]] and [[Spain]].
*[[1614]] &ndash; [[Adriaen Block]] and 12 [[Amsterdam]] merchants petition the [[Estates-General of the Netherlands|States General]] for exclusive trading rights in the [[New Netherland]] colony.
*[[1634]] &ndash; The [[Burchardi flood]] – "the second Grote Mandrenke" killed around 15,000 men in [[North Friesland]], Denmark and Germany.
*[[1649]] &ndash; [[Sack of Wexford]]: After a ten-day siege, English [[New Model Army]] troops (under [[Oliver Cromwell]]) stormed the town of [[Wexford]], killing over 2,000 [[Irish Catholic Confederation|Irish Confederate]] troops and 1,500 civilians.
*[[1727]] &ndash; [[George II of Great Britain|George II]] and [[Caroline of Ansbach]] are crowned [[List of British monarchs|King]] and [[List of British consorts|Queen]] of [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Great Britain]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Battle of Valcour Island]] &ndash; On [[Lake Champlain]] a fleet of [[United States|American]] boats is defeated by the [[Royal Navy]], but delays the British advance until 1777.
*[[1797]] &ndash; [[Battle of Camperdown]]: Naval battle between [[Royal Navy]] and [[Royal Netherlands Navy]] during the [[French Revolutionary Wars]]. The outcome of the battle was a decisive British victory.
*[[1809]] &ndash; Along the [[Natchez Trace]] in [[Tennessee]], explorer [[Meriwether Lewis]] dies under mysterious circumstances at an inn called Grinder's Stand.
*[[1811]] &ndash; Inventor [[John Stevens (inventor)|John Stevens]]' boat, the ''Juliana'', begins operation as the first [[steam]]-powered [[ferry]] (service between [[New York City]], [[New York]], and [[Hoboken, New Jersey]]).
*[[1833]] &ndash; A big demonstration at the gates of the legislature of [[Buenos Aires]] forces the ousting of governor [[Juan Ramón Balcarce]] and his replacement with [[Juan José Viamonte]].
*[[1852]] &ndash; The [[University of Sydney]], [[Australia]]'s oldest [[university]], is inaugurated in [[Sydney]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: In the aftermath of the [[Battle of Antietam]], [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] General [[J.E.B. Stuart]] and his men loot [[Chambersburg, Pennsylvania]], during a raid into the north.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[Campina Grande]], [[Brazil]] is established as a city.
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[Paul Bogle]] led hundreds of black men and women in a march in [[Jamaica]], starting the [[Morant Bay rebellion]].
*[[1890]] &ndash; In [[Washington, DC]], the [[Daughters of the American Revolution]] is founded.
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]] begins: In [[South Africa]], a war between the [[United Kingdom]] and the [[Boers]] of the [[South African Republic|Transvaal]] and [[Orange Free State]] erupts.
*  1899   &ndash; The [[Western League (U.S. baseball)|Western League]] is renamed the [[American League]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[San Francisco, California|San Francisco]] public school board sparks a [[Gentlemen's Agreement of 1907|diplomatic crisis]] between the [[United States]] and [[Japan]] by ordering Japanese students to be taught in racially segregated schools.
*[[1910]] &ndash; Former President [[Theodore Roosevelt]] becomes the first U.S. president to fly in an airplane. He flew for four minutes with [[Arch Hoxsey]] in a plane built by the [[Wright Brothers]] at Kinloch Field ([[Lambert-St. Louis International Airport]]), [[St. Louis, Missouri]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[First Balkan War]]: The [[Hellenic Army|Greek Army]] liberates the city of [[Kozani]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[1918 San Fermín earthquake|San Fermín earthquake]] hits western [[Puerto Rico]].
*[[1929]] &ndash; [[JC Penney]] opens store #1252 in [[Milford, Delaware]], making it a nationwide company with stores in all 48 [[U.S. state]]s.
*[[1941]] &ndash; Beginning of the [[National Liberation War of Macedonia]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Cape Esperance]] &ndash; On the northwest coast of [[Guadalcanal]], [[United States Navy]] ships intercept and defeat a [[Japan]]ese fleet on their way to reinforce troops on the island.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Tuvinian People's Republic]] or formerly [[Tannu Tuva]] is annexed by the U.S.S.R
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Television]]: CBS's [[Field-sequential color system|mechanical color system]] is the first to be licensed for broadcast by the U.S. [[Federal Communications Commission]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[First Indochina War]]: The [[Viet Minh]] take control of [[North Vietnam]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Space Race]]:  [[The M.I.T. Computation Center and Operation Moonwatch|M.I.T.]] scientists calculate [[Sputnik I]]'s [[Sputnik rocket|booster rocket's]] [[orbit]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Pioneer program]]: [[NASA]] launches the lunar probe [[Pioneer 1]] (the probe falls back to [[Earth]] and burns up).
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Second Vatican Council]]: [[Pope John XXIII]] convenes the first [[ecumenical council]] of the [[Roman Catholic Church]] in 92 years.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Project Apollo|Apollo program]]: [[NASA]] launches ''[[Apollo 7]],'' the first successful manned Apollo mission, with [[astronaut]]s [[Wally Schirra]], [[Donn F. Eisele]] and [[Walter Cunningham]] aboard.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[USS Kitty Hawk riot|A race riot]] occurs on the [[United States Navy]] [[aircraft carrier]] [[USS Kitty Hawk (CV-63)|''Kitty Hawk'']] off the coast of [[Vietnam]] during [[Operation Linebacker]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[NBC]] sketch comedy/variety show ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' debuts with [[George Carlin]] as the host and [[Andy Kaufman]], [[Janis Ian]] and [[Billy Preston]] as guests.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[George Washington]]'s appointment, posthumously, to the grade of [[General of the Armies of the United States]] by congressional joint resolution [[s:Public Law 94-479|Public Law 94-479]] is approved by President [[Gerald R. Ford]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; The ''[[Mary Rose]]'', a Tudor [[carrack]] which sank on July 19, 1545, is salvaged from the sea bed of the [[Solent]], off [[Portsmouth]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; Aboard the [[Space Shuttle Challenger|Space Shuttle ''Challenger'']], astronaut [[Kathryn D. Sullivan]] becomes the first [[United States|American]] woman to perform a [[space walk]].
*  1984  &ndash; An [[Aeroflot]] [[Tupolev Tu-154]] [[Aeroflot Flight 3352|crashes into maintenance vehicles]] upon landing in [[Omsk]], [[Russia]], killing 178.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: [[U.S.]] President [[Ronald Reagan]] and [[USSR|Soviet]] leader [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] [[Reykjavík Summit|meet]] in [[Reykjavík]], [[Iceland]], in an effort to continue discussions about scaling back their intermediate [[missile]] arsenals in [[Europe]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; Start of [[Operation Pawan]] by [[Indian Peace Keeping Force]] in [[Sri Lanka]] that killed thousands of ethnic [[Tamil people|Tamil]] civilians and hundreds of [[Tamil Tigers]] & [[Indian Army]] soldiers.
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[Pala accident]]: a wood [[lorry]] and [[school bus]] collide in Jõgeva county, [[Estonia]], killing eight children.
*[[2000]] &ndash; NASA launches [[STS-92]], the 100th [[Space Shuttle]] mission, using [[Space Shuttle Discovery]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; The [[Polaroid Corporation]] files for federal [[bankruptcy]] protection.
*[[2002]] &ndash; A [[Myyrmanni bombing|bomb attack]] in a shopping mall in [[Vantaa]], [[Finland]] kills seven.
